newsitem.title: USA: IQ Software sees small Q4 operating loss.
newsitem.headline: IQ Software sees small Q4 operating loss.

text.p: IQ Software Corp said on Tuesday it expected to post a small operating loss in its fourth quarter on revenues of about $5.9 million to $6.2 million.
IQ Software was not immediately available to comment further. The company had revenues of $6 million in the year-ago fourth quarter. In last year's fourth quarter, IQ said it earned $0.11 per share.
Chief Executive Officer Rick Chitty said: "Although these results are below expectations, we remain optimistic about the company's prospects for the current year."
Chitty said the market for decision support tools was healthy and the company made sizable investments during the year in building distribution, which should drive revenue.
IQ Software said it planned to announce definitive results on or about March 3.
IQ Software provides client/server end-user decision support tools.
